title: Liquid or debris in USB-C port replaced by "Charging connected device via USB".
content:
I bought a Pixel 4a in December 2020. Zero problems until about a week ago, I started to get notifications about "USB disabled, liquid or debris detected."

I could not see any liquid or debris, so I powered off, and on. The message reappeared, but soon disappeared. Only  to reappear every few days. Which worries me. 

And this time, when the liquid/debris message eventually vanished, it was replaced with with a new message, "Charging connected device via USB". But my phone is not connected to a charger, there is nothing plugged into the USB-C port

I have no idea what is going on, and decided to ask the community for advice, before I go to Google support. Any help much appreciated.
